body:
That looks like a reasonable request and it has a well defined error `teamDriveFileLimitExceeded` so should be easy to detect.

It would need a bit of extra logic here

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/bde0334bd8e2c16d9fbc49758cd9374f1d741bd2/backend/drive/drive.go#L613-L618

Fancy having a go?

I'll give it a go....this is new territory for me as I run rclone using the rclone plugin, so I'll have to work out how to install my own version.

If I want to help test rclone union as well, do I fork this branch?

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/pr-3782-union

> I'll give it a go....this is new territory for me as I run rclone using the rclone plugin, so I'll have to work out how to install my own version.

There are some brief instructions on a source install here: https://rclone.org/install/#install-from-source



> If I want to help test rclone union as well, do I fork this branch?
> 
> https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/pr-3782-union

Yes that is right
@BinsonBuzz Did you test it? Does it work?
Sorry no.  I changed the way I do my backup to using chunks now with duplicati, so I'm nowhere near the 400k mark now.
Anyone want to pick this up?

issue.title: make error quotaLimitReached (onedrive) and teamDriveFileLimitExceeded (google drive) to be fatal

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you very much for contributing code or documentation to rclone! Please
fill out the following questions to make it easier for us to review your
changes.

You do not need to check all the boxes below all at once, feel free to take
your time and add more commits. If you're done and ready for review, please
check the last box.
-->

#### What is the purpose of this change?

# 1st commit

Stop sync when OneDrive has no storage left. OneDrive returns HTTP response code `507` and error code `quotaLimitReached` when that happens.

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

Yes. Fixes #4089

```
harry@ubuntu16:/mnt/c/Users/HARRY/rclone$ ./rclone copy "/mnt/c/Users/HARRY/1GbTestFile.bin" onedrive1:
2020/03/25 18:19:19 ERROR : 1GbTestFile.bin: Failed to copy: quotaLimitReached: Quota limit reached
2020/03/25 18:19:19 ERROR : Fatal error received - not attempting retries
2020/03/25 18:19:19 Failed to copy: quotaLimitReached: Quota limit reached
```

# 2nd commit

Stop sync when Team Drive has reached its maximum files limit and flag `--drive-stop-on-upload-limit` set to **true**.

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

Yes. Fixes #3979

# 3rd commit

Stop sync when Dropbox has no storage/space left.

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

No.

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-pull-request).
- [ ] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [ ] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

body: I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) in 15-30 mins and released in v1.52
I am wondering, if i upload to a series of Team Drive under Rclone Union (TD1: TD2: TD3: TD4:), and once the TD1: drive hit this error, will it automatic go to next team drive TD2?

> once the TD1: drive hit this error, will it automatic go to next team drive TD2?

Not yet, but it should...

> > once the TD1: drive hit this error, will it automatic go to next team drive TD2?
> 
> Not yet, but it should...

Can you please elaborate further? what do you mean by that?

I have a similar setup. Once the error is hit for a certain drive, should it not continue with another drive? I have multiple TDs configured in cron job, which are cycled every hour to back up new content off my server
